issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A fix has been committed, and will be part of the next release
status.name: Release Pending

fields.description:
When using persistent connections responses after the first will be missing the date/server headers.

This can be seen using euca-describe-images as this command issues multiple requests:

{code}
#
# euca-describe-images --debug
2017-06-13 15:48:16,374 DEBUG   DescribeImages parsed arguments from CLI: {'all': False, 'filters': None, 'security_token': None, 'url': None, 'region': None, 'ImageId': [], 'show_empty_fields': False, 'Owner': None, 'key_id': None, 'secret_key': None, 'ExecutableBy': None}
2017-06-13 15:48:16,374 INFO    Config finding global option default-region
2017-06-13 15:48:16,374 INFO    Config   found   default-region = g-15-09.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com
2017-06-13 15:48:16,375 INFO    EC2 selected region "g-15-09.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com" from "default-region" global config option

2017-06-13 15:48:16,375 INFO    Config finding region option user

{code}
2017-06-13 15:48:16,457 DEBUG   EC2 response header: date: Tue, 13 Jun 2017 22:48:16 GMT
2017-06-13 15:48:16,457 DEBUG   EC2 response header: server: Eucalyptus/4.4.1
{code}

but the second response does not.
fields.summary: HTTP responses on persistent connection missing date/server headers

comments.body:
I tried this in my environment.  The output looks correct now:
{code}
[root@g-15-08 ~]# euca-describe-images --debug --region testuser@ 2>&1 | grep header:
